title: ESE Pre-K (Exceptional Student Education Preschool)
shortDescription: Free public preschool for children ages 3-5 with disabilities, available in every Florida school district.
description: Florida's ESE Pre-K program provides free, specialized preschool education for children ages 3-5 who have been identified with a disability — including autism spectrum disorder, developmental delays, and speech-language impairments. These classrooms are located inside regular public elementary schools and are staffed by certified ESE teachers. Children receive an Individualized Education Program (IEP) with built-in therapies such as speech, occupational therapy, and behavioral support during the school day. Every one of Florida's 67 school districts operates ESE Pre-K classrooms, making this the most widely available and affordable childcare option for families of children with autism.
benefits: 100% free — no tuition, no copays, no fees
Available in every Florida county through local school districts
IEP-driven instruction tailored to each child's needs
On-site therapies (speech, OT, behavioral) included at no cost
Classroom models range from inclusive to self-contained based on needs
Smooth transition into kindergarten ESE services
Staff are certified ESE teachers with specialized training
whoCanBenefit: Children ages 3-5 with an autism diagnosis
Children with developmental delays, speech impairments, or other qualifying disabilities
Families who cannot afford private preschool or therapy
Children transitioning out of Early Steps (birth-to-3) services
Any Florida resident child with a qualifying IEP
howToQualify: Contact your local school district's Child Find office
Request a free evaluation for your child
If eligible, the school develops an IEP with your input
Placement begins — typically within 30 days of IEP completion
Children under 3 can be referred through Early Steps, which transitions to ESE Pre-K at age 3
